entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 1999/9. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-E08: TÁRKI Omnibus 1999/9. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2009-04-09
entry.dcterms:creator: 1. Gazsó, Tibor
2. Tóth, Zsolt
3. Sági, Matild
entry.dcterms:subject: 2004-03-00: the labels of the data file are corrected and complemented
entry.dcterms:description: 1. party preferences and political attitudes, opinions about political players, expectations regarding the country's economic situation and people's evaluations of their own financial situation 2. willingness and motivation for child bearing and rearing, assumptions about country's population decrease, opinions regarding the government's population policy, views about the ideal family structure, attitudes about parenting roles of men and women, factors influencing child bearing and rearing, views about the effectiveness of various family support resources for population number 3. sex life, sexual problems, attitudes about sexual disorders
entry.dcterms:subject: housing
social stratification and groupings
family life, marriage, relationship
religion and values
demography
social conditions and indicators
gender and gender roles

social welfare policy and systems
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
Personal interview with interviewer, and self-administered questionnaire (block on sex life).
A
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
